The machine has a rotationally driven shaft arranged in the production direction of the packaging machine, which drives tool members of various work stations to execute lifting movements. The transfer mechanism converts the rotation of the shaft into the movement required to operate the tool members. The shaft is driven in a continuous 360Â° rotation, and the work stations may be arranged on different vertical levels to save space. The frame supports the shaft and stabilizes it to prevent vibrations, and two transfer mechanisms may be provided to lift the tool members of each work station.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a finishing article drive member assembly, specifically a grinding wheel, that is permanently affixed to a drive member without the use of adhesives. The grinding wheel includes a backing flange with a central opening and a depressed center, and a retaining nut is inserted through the opening in the grinding wheel and the flange to secure them together. The retaining nut has a radial flange and protrusions that non-removably secure the nut and flange together. A pressure cap is provided to engage the spindle of the power tool and place the grinding wheel in compression during use. The grinding wheel is made of depressed center material and the flange has lands that engage the back surface of the wheel. The retaining nut has threads for attachment to the spindle and the gripping means on the flange secures the wheel to the spindle.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system, which includes a housing block, a motor, and a plurality of pistons. The motor is located above an eccentric chamber, and a conduit leads downward from the eccentric chamber to a central venting point. The unit also includes at least one reservoir for temporarily receiving pressure fluid. The pressure fluid entrained into the eccentric chamber by the pistons is delivered to the at least one spring chamber, far from electrical components. The features of the invention offer advantages such as cost savings, ease of production, and protection of electrical components from moisture. The unit can be produced without changing its size or basic internal design, and the only provision necessary is the disposition of the characteristics defined herein. The invention yields a practical exemplary embodiment for containers with favorable production standpoints, and the seal can be made in a favorable way from a production standpoint, with less sealing material consumed.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a power and free conveyor system where a carrier is transferred from one predetermined path to another by pushing across a transfer zone in a minimum period of time. The system includes a third dog that is selectively operable to transfer the carrier across short or long distances. The third dog is held by the track out of operative position but can be brought to operative position to transfer the carrier. The invention provides a power and free conveyor system with minimum cost and maintenance, and selective transfer of the carrier can be achieved over short and long distances. The system includes a cam projection on the second dog that engages portions of the track to hold the second dog out of operative position.
</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a grounding product for railroad car center plate assembly bowl liners, specifically providing a conductive liner that eliminates the need for additional grounding apparatus. The liner is composed of a base ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) material with a conductive material additive, and can be formed through various methods. The improved liner still has all the benefits of the liner as disclosed in Chierici et al, with the additional benefit of being conductive and providing uninterrupted electrical conductivity. The invention provides a cost-effective solution that eliminates the need for periodic inspection and wear of grounding clips, and reduces the risk of intermittent contact due to car roll or pitch.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a valve used for controlling the dispensing of viscous substances from a bag or pouch. The valve includes a tubular sleeve mounted on the spout of the bag and a gate valve member that can be moved between opened and closed positions. The gate valve member is reciprocated on a guide member relative to the sleeve by means of an integral upward guide and operating channel-like extension. The valve assembly can be mounted on the spout of a bag and used in a dispenser to dispense the contents of the bag with one hand only. The valve can be easily disassembled for cleaning and reassembled. The gate valve member can be moved between opened and closed positions with the fingers of one hand, and the valve can function when the valve assembly is in an inclined position. The valve provides an effective seal when in the closed position and allows for variable flow when moved towards the closed position. The valve can be used in a dispenser of the type indicated and can function when mounted on a bag carrying the valve assembly.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention provides a vehicle rearview mirror system that is tolerant of different protocols of an output of a vehicle control. The system includes a variable reflective element that assumes a partial reflectance level in response to a drive signal. The mirror system also includes a microcomputer that determines the protocol of the output of the vehicle control and maintains a reverse-inhibit-running parameter and a reverse-inhibit-ignition-cycle parameter. The microcomputer compares these parameters with two limits and adjusts the reflectance level of the reflective element based on the comparison.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles, particularly for a front wheel brake. The system includes an anti-dive device that is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel. The device is achieved by tapping hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit or by sensing and applying the actual reaction to braking force of the front wheel. The system aims to provide an anti-lock braking system with anti-dive characteristics.

The embodiments of the present invention are described, including a first embodiment where the anti-lock control unit is provided in a hydraulic pipe connecting the front master cylinder and the brake caliper. The unit consists of a hydraulic pump, modulator, and pressure discharge valve. The modulator has a hydraulic control chamber, pump piston, and operating piston. The pressure discharge valve is normally closed and opens when the front wheel is nearly locked.

The second embodiment is similar to the first embodiment but with a different configuration of the hydraulic pipe. The anti-lock control unit is provided in a casing formed of a cup-shaped case member and a cover member fitted into an open end of the case member. The cover member is supported on the axle via a hollow shaft and joined to the front fork so that the case member does not turn around the axle.

The hydraulic pump consists of a cam shaft, push rod, pump piston, and operating piston. The push rod and pump piston are fitted slidably in a first cylindrical bore formed in the cover member, and the operating piston is fitted slidably in the plug fitted fixedly into the outer end portion of the first cylindrical bore. The inlet chamber is communicated with the oil tank via a pipe, and the outlet chamber is communicated with the front master cylinder via a suction valve.

The modulator consists of a pressure reduction piston, fixed piston, and return spring. The pressure reduction piston defines a hydraulic control chamber and a hydraulic output chamber, and the fixed piston defines a hydraulic input chamber.

The present invention relates to a partition system for a refrigerated trailer, railcar, or container, which includes at least two panels that are independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies, allowing each panel to be moved independently. The panels are slidably attached to ceiling-mounted rails in the trailer, and a trolley assembly is used to move the panels in the axial direction. The panels can be raised and lowered with a minimum of fore and aft clearance, and the system can be modified to provide additional or different functionalities.

The present invention relates to a novel sanitizable rotary valve that combines elements from prior art valves with a unique feature of partial separation of the rotor-stator faces to allow flushing across the process fluid-contacting surfaces. The valve design allows for sanitizing in place (SIP) without disassembling the valve, and the elastomeric diaphragm seal functions to both seal the two faces together in normal use and retain the sanitizing process fluids when the faces are partially separated for cleaning. The invention also includes an insert molding process for forming a rotary valve diaphragm seal.

<summary>The present invention relates to gas-liquid contacting trays and improvements in valve-tray assemblies. The invention includes an improved tray valve assembly for a process column where liquid flows downwardly from a downcomer onto a first tray and thereacross in a first direction upon the active area thereof through which vapor flows upwardly for interaction and mass transfer with the liquid before passing therefrom.</summary>

The valve assembly comprises a plurality of apertures formed in the tray, a valve cover mounted thereon, and first and second legs mounted to the tray in outwardly slotted portions thereof. The legs are disposed to intercept the flow of liquid across the tray and are wider than the second leg, with means for selectively biasing the rear region of the valve upwardly against the flow of liquid for facilitating initial, directionalized vapor flow therethrough.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating a fluid pressure. The invention provides a fluid pressure regulator assembly that reduces variances in an output pressure as the result of large differences in input pressure. The assembly includes a pressurized fluid source, high-pressure line, fluid regulator, output line, burner, and rotisserie. The vane motor is coupled to the fluid regulator and generates power as the fluid flows through the vanes. The invention also provides a diver and diving gear utilizing the present invention.
The fluid regulator is designed to reduce the effects of large pressure variances on a fluid output pressure. The vane motor is constructed of stainless steel and provides a mechanical advantage to the fluid regulator. The guide block has a square cross-section with a width only slightly smaller than the width of the interior space defined by the first lost motion linkage. The drum shaft is coupled to a back plate bolted to the casing, and the drive shaft is positioned slightly higher than the drum shaft and coupled to a front plate bolted to the casing.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to pallet systems that restrict both the lateral and longitudinal movement of items loaded onto the pallet. The pallet system includes a pallet with raised parallel guide rails and trays slid along the guide rails. The end plates are secured to the stack of trays and have an inside surface shaped to complement the outside surface of the stack of trays. The pallet system provides enhanced stability when loaded and wrapped, and allows trays to be slid on and off, making it suitable for automated loading and unloading.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a flying saucer with a rotary-wing system and a control system. The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system with magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail. The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels consist of blades connected to a magnetic suspension inner ring and a magnetic suspension outer ring. The blades form an impeller, and the magnetic suspension inner ring and outer ring are suspended in the space restricted by the electromotive ring and the magnetic suspension shaft. The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended on the magnetic suspension shaft in the radial direction by relying on a magnetic suspension radial bearing. The magnetic suspension inner ring is suspended between the inner ring upper guideway and the inner ring lower guideway in the axial direction by relying on a magnetic suspension axial bearing. The magnetic suspension outer ring is suspended between the outer ring upper guideway and the outer ring lower guideway in the axial direction by relying on a magnetic suspension axial bearing. The invention aims to make full use of the limited internal space of the saucer shell and design a compact and lightweight rotary-wing flying saucer with high motive power conversion efficiency and easy manipulation and control.

<summary>
The present invention relates to streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands, particularly for the streptavidin/peptide ligand system used in protein isolation and detection methods. The invention aims to optimize the streptavidin/peptide ligand system by modifying the streptavidin sequence to improve the binding affinity. The mutated streptavidin muteins have a higher binding affinity than the wild-type streptavidin for the peptide ligand, and this affinity can be further improved by using additional labels or modifying the streptavidin sequence. The invention also concerns a nucleic acid that encodes the streptavidin mutein and a vector that contains the nucleic acid in an operatively functional environment. The improved binding affinity of the streptavidin muteins makes them useful for protein isolation and detection methods, particularly in the context of the streptavidin/peptide ligand system.
</summary>

The present invention relates to methods for forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts. The methods involve treating amines with guanylating agents, such as thioureas or isothioureas, in the presence of a nickel catalyst.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a novel apparatus and method for continuously electrolytically coloring aluminum strips or wires. The invention involves an anodic oxidation bath for anodizing the aluminum strip or wire and an electrolytic coloring bath for electrolytically coloring the anodized aluminum strip or wire. The electric current used in the anodic oxidation can be a direct current or direct and alternating superposed currents. The aluminum strip or wire having the oxide film or layer formed in the anodization is then continuously immersed in an electrolytic bath containing at least one of a nickel salt, a cobalt salt, a copper salt, a tin salt, and selenious acid. The current density and the electrolytic period of time in the bath are controlled by the area of the aluminum strip or wire immersed, the amount of electric current applied, and the period of immersion of the aluminum strip or wire.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a process of producing transgenic plants or plant cells transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest, capable of expressing a function of interest from said DNA sequence. The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors that recombine with each other to produce a non-replicating recombination product containing the DNA sequence of interest, and selecting plants or plant cells expressing the function of interest.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor that improves the durability and efficiency of the compressor by applying a fluorocarbon coating on the swash plate facial surfaces and ends. The coating includes a polyfluoro elastomer, a lubricious additive, and a load bearing additive, which provides a low coefficient of friction surface. The invention is different from prior designs by bonding and cross-linking the fluorocarbon directly to the aluminum, rather than electroplating or using a high silicon aluminum base material. The coating is applied to the swash plate using a liquid spray, and the ratio of liquid to solid portions is between 40% to 90% liquid portion to 60% to 10% solid portion. The invention improves the durability and efficiency of the compressor by reducing friction and wear on the components.
</summary>

The present invention relates to organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings in photolithography processes for forming submicro-patterns on semiconductor devices. The polymers are designed to absorb light strongly at specific wavelengths to prevent standing wave effects and light reflection. The invention provides novel chemical compounds for use in anti-reflective coatings, as well as preparation methods and composition thereof. The polymers can be used in combination with light-absorbing compounds to enhance their absorption properties. The invention also provides methods for forming anti-reflective coatings and the coatings themselves, which can be used in lithography processes to improve the efficiency of photoresist layers.

<summary>
The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic. The film contains at least one white pigment and one flame retardant and has good orientability and thermoformability, and very good optical and mechanical properties. The invention also relates to the use of this film and to a process for its production. The film does not comprise UV absorbers of any kind as light stabilizers and does not comprise flame retardants of any kind, and therefore neither the film nor the items produced from it are suitable for outdoor applications that demand fire protection or flame retardancy. The film is also intended to pass the UL 94 test, which means that it can be classified in class 94 VTM-0. The invention aims to provide a cost-effective and commercially viable solution for producing a flame-retardant film that can be used in outdoor applications. The film is produced by feeding a crystallizable thermoplastic, a white pigment, and a flame retardant directly during the production of the film by way of masterbatch technology. The film does not embrittle on brief exposure to heat and does not exhibit any impairment of mechanical properties after several years in outdoor applications.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an improved method for producing 1,1,1-trifluoroethane (143a) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-dichloroethylene using heterogeneous catalysts. The invention provides a new practical process for the production of 143a with very high conversion and selectivity (both over 99%) for 143a. The prior art discloses various methods for producing 143a, including batch liquid phase processes, but these processes have limitations such as low selectivity, low yield, or require expensive feeds. The invention provides a simple, convenient, economical, and industrial process for the manufacturing of 143a. The catalyst used in the invention is a combination of iron oxide, rare earth oxide, and zirconium oxide, which has been found to provide high selectivity and conversion for 143a. The invention also provides a practical process for the production of 143a from methylchloroform, which is an expensive compound. The process involves the use of a bismuth containing catalyst supported on alumina, which has been found to provide high selectivity and conversion for 143a.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of compounds having the formula:

The process involves the use of hypophosphorous acid, which reduces the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities formed during the reaction. The process also improves the yield of the desired product and is straight-forward and readily carried out.

The invention provides a process for the preparation of a 3,6-di-substituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole having the formula:

The process involves reacting an acylated compound with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and the pyrazolotriazole.

The process generates less sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities than when no hypophosphorous acid is present. The invention also provides a process for the preparation of a 3,6-di-substituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole from a 3,6-disubstituted-7H-1,2,4-triazolo[3,4-b]-[1,3,4]thiadiazine having the formula:

The process involves reacting the thiadiazine with an acylating agent to form an acylated intermediate and subsequently reacting the acylated intermediate with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and the pyrazolotriazole.

The invention is not critically dependent on the type of groups designated R and R', as long as the groups meet certain criteria. The radical R' represents lower alkyl radicals, preferably those having up to about 6 carbon atoms.

The process may be conducted in the presence of a catalytic quantity of a Bronsted or Lewis acid. The acylation may be conducted at any convenient temperature and the reaction time is not a completely independent variable.
</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures by sequentially taking small quantities of fiber from different fiber lots. The method involves measuring the initial total quantity of each fiber bale, calculating a partial quantity, and removing it continuously from the measured bale without leaving residual fibers. The apparatus includes a bale opener for removing fibers, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that controls the mode of operation of the opener. The invention ensures that the opening of the fiber bales is done without residual fibers and provides a optimally homogeneous mixture.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics, wherein the yarns are laid at an angle of between 30Â° and 150Â° to the long axis of the fabric, and the layers are held together by stitching or adhesive bonding. The invention improves upon prior art methods by providing parallel courses of yarn and reducing waste due to yarn overlap.</summary>

The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in and through warp sheds in a multiple-color air jet loom, where air under pressure is ejected from a main nozzle unit or a main nozzle unit and subnozzles to produce different weft carrying forces for carrying the weft threads through the warp shed at a constant speed. The invention provides a solution to the problem of wasteful consumption of pressurized air by ejecting the air under different pressures from the subnozzles, or supplying air under pressure from the subnozzles for different intervals of time selected for the weft threads.

The present invention relates to a process for spinning bast fibers, which involves health preservation, drawing, and spinning. The process aims to improve the flexibility and spinnability of bast fibers, reducing end breakage rate. Examples of the invention show that the end breakage rate of yarn can be reduced by 150-200 times per hour for each machine when the yarn is 12 s in fineness. The invention also covers a process for blended spinning bast fibers and other fibers, which involves health preservation, blending, opening, cleaning, carding, drawing, and spinning.

<summary>
The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for measuring and removing the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses. The invention provides a method and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses used in papermaking and other industries. The invention uses multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions to detect and measure rotational variability along the length of the covered roll. The sensors provide real-time data on the pressure being developed along the nip region of the press, allowing for more accurate display of the nip pressure profile. The invention can compensate for rotational variability by calculating an average pressure value at each cross-directional position along the sensing roll. The invention can also calculate and obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile using other models, such as curve fitting. The present invention provides a more accurate measurement of the true nip pressure profile and can detect and measure any effects of rotational variability along the length of the covered roll.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an apparatus mounted on an ironing board for guiding a cord of an iron and providing a holder for an article. The article has a clamp section for releasably securing the apparatus to the ironing board. A flexible cord support is pivotably attached to the clamp for supporting the electrical cord of the electrical appliance above the ironing board. An article holder is mounted to the clamp for holding an article. An electrical receptacle is carried by the clamp for receiving a plug of the electrical cord of the iron. The invention has a detachable article holder with a lower circular hoop and support bars for retaining an article. The clamp has a second support for detachably mounting the article holder. The apparatus has an extension portion for mounting a female electrical outlet. The article holder is removable from the second brace by raising it vertically, thereby removing the tangs from the openings.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine, which includes a foot pad and a travelling assembly. The travelling assembly moves with the work fed during sewing and includes a slidable member that can be positioned by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn. The device is peculiarly adapted to accomplish the primary objective of the invention, which is to provide a buttonhole controlling device that can be rendered effective regardless of the type of material being sewn. The device controls the operation of the machine to sew a buttonhole when in a buttonhole mode, and the particular manner in which the machine is constructed to cause a buttonhole to be sewn is not described in detail. The device includes an adjustable stop that engages a tripping lever to terminate the formation of a buttonhole, and the position of the adjustable stop can be varied to accommodate different sizes of buttons. The invention provides a buttonhole controlling device that can be used to sew buttonholes in different materials without the need for adjustments, and the device can be readjusted while working with a sample of the new material before buttonholes are sewn in the new garment.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid. The apparatus includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch. The conveyor includes an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a predetermined path. The liquid applicator is disposed at a first station along the path for applying the liquid to the web during motion thereof along the path. The suction device is disposed at a second station along the path for removing the liquid from the web by suction during motion of the web along the path. The dwell stretch is disposed between the applicator and the suction device for conducting the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop. The invention improves the washing effect by lengthening the action time of the applied liquid on the substances to be removed from the fabric or textile web. The fabric treatment apparatus can have a compact construction, particularly if the textile web is guided back from the dwell loop to the sieve belt at a point downstream and closely adjacent to the point where the web leaves the belt. The suction device causes the textile web to adhere to the belt and to be entrained thereby, without appreciable longitudinal tensile stresses occurring in the web.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an air flow system for a dry cleaner that induces ambient air into the access opening of the machine whenever the door is opened. The system is exclusive of the air recirculating system and reduces exhausting the residual solvent vapors from the tubs. The invention provides a separate intake fan and duct with a normally closed valve that is energized during the drying cycle to induce air into the access opening and directly into the interposed duct. The vapors within the tubs are retained, and the loss of solvent is minimized. The air flow system includes a timer-energized component during each portion of the dry cleaning cycle, and a refrigeration system for solvent vapor recovery. The complete operation of the electrical components is controlled through a well-known timer mechanism, and the operative cycle includes a washing portion, a drain portion, a spin or centrifuging portion, and a drying portion.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming a melt-spun nonwoven web. The invention improves upon conventional nonwoven production machines by harnessing the advantages of both eductive and non-eductive systems while minimizing their drawbacks. The invention involves an initial quench chamber and the use of a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width, which produces a linear plane of filaments in the slot impingement point section. The system and method of the present invention are simpler and more efficient than conventional systems, with improved web formation control, reduced energy consumption, and improved machine element cleanliness.

<summary>
Embodiments of the present disclosure provide a sewing machine, an embroidery unit, and a non-transitory computer-readable medium storing a sewing machine control program that enable easily setting a position, on a work cloth, at which sewing is performed. The sewing machine includes at least one detecting portion, a processor, and a memory. The at least one detecting portion detects an ultrasonic wave that has been transmitted from a transmission source, and the memory stores computer-readable instructions that instruct the sewing machine to execute steps including identifying a position of the transmission source of the ultrasonic wave based on information pertaining to the ultrasonic wave that has been detected by the at least one detecting portion, and controlling sewing based on the position of the transmission source that has been identified.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to preparations for application onto cellulosic fabric or textile materials, comprising wool particles or wool powder as functional additive carriers. The wool particles or powder have a size of 200 nm or below and are used to carry functional additives such as ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial agents, or other clothing functions. The preparation is formed by pulverizing wool into ultrafine wool powder and adding functional additives, acrylic copolymer binder, and water. The ultrafine wool powder is attached onto the cotton fabric by means of aqueous dispersion of acrylic copolymer binder. The invention provides a method of preparing a preparation comprising bamboo fibre as a functional additive, which involves pulverizing bamboo fibre into ultrafine bamboo powder and adding functional additives, acrylic copolymer binder, and water. The functional additives may include zinc oxide, titanium oxide, or other comparable agents. The preparation is bonded or deposited onto the cellulosic fabric material by printing, padding, or foam application. The present invention provides enhanced moisture management, wicking, and wrinkling resistance properties of the article.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a frame quilting machine that allows an operator to remotely program a precise pattern into a large bedspread or quilt using a computer aided design program. The machine includes a sewing machine head and a quilting table that can move in the X-direction, Y-direction, or any combination X-Y direction through a remote control apparatus. The invention also includes two separate computers, one for controlling the sewing machine function and one for controlling the quilting table movement, which can be reprogrammed separately.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing nonwoven fabrics using hydroentanglement, wherein a three-dimensional image is imparted to the fabric. The invention involves the use of a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim to enhance the imaging process and improve the mechanical properties of the fabric. The fabric is formed from a first precursor web and a second precursor web, which are juxtaposed and subjected to hydroentanglement on a moveable imaging surface. The use of a fiber distribution control layer between the two sides of the fabric helps to limit the intermingling of the fibrous constituents and improve the resistance to delamination. The invention also provides for the use of various techniques to enhance the imaging process, such as minimizing tension in the precursor web. The resulting fabric exhibits a pronounced three-dimensional image that is durable to converting and end-use applications.
</summary>

The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric. The device includes a guide apparatus for feeding the strip of material, a control setup for controlling the operation of the device, and a sewing machine with a bed plate, slide, needle plate, and legs for feeding the workpiece.

<summary>The invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in the collar of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tank top, lower end portion of a baseball stocking, or the like. The method involves overlaying symmetrical loops of the final course of both tape-shaped knit pieces across the boundary and binding off the overlaid part gradually until the end parts of the tape-shaped knit fabrics are joined.</summary>

The invention relates to a flexible traction element made of stranded cables, which can be wound and unwound, and a production line for producing the same. The traction element has a core strand surrounded by multiple peripheral strands, and the strands are sheathed with a flexible thermoplastic plastics material. The production line includes a reel for unwinding the strands, a device for orienting the strands, a heater for preheating the strands, and a cooling trough. The strands are degreased and pretreated to improve adhesion before being sheathed with the plastics material. The traction element has improved flexibility and adhesion over long-term use, and can be used for lifting and pulling loads, and as an electric conductor.

<summary>The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, which includes first and second cams arranged on respective sides of a projection of the bobbin housing of a rotatable hook for controlling the rotation of the bobbin housing. The invention provides a simple, rugged, and economical design that hinders the guiding of the needle thread loop and prevents the bobbin housing from rotating during the loop formation process. The capsule release device gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, allowing the needle thread loop to move through a small gap between the front side face and the front cam without being hindered. The invention reduces the impediment of the thread movement caused by the bending of the spring rod, allowing the needle thread tension to be reduced to a minimum during the reverse rotation of the bobbin housing.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to materials and methods for producing silicon-based micro and nanofibers. The invention involves the use of liquid silanes, polymers, accelerants, and solvents to create composites that can be used in various applications. The electrospinning method is used to produce the silicon-based nanofibers, which can be transformed into a-Si:H at a temperature of approximately 350Â° C. The invention also includes the use of four- and five-component inks that can be used with electrospinning techniques. The methods of the invention offer the ability to tailor the chemical composition of the silicon wires by adjusting the precursor chemistries to achieve desired conductivities and structural stability.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel. The invention provides an improved tension control by employing a plurality of fluid pressure sensitive biasing arrangements, each connected to a different spool holder in the creel. The biasing arrangements are simultaneously settable by fluid pressure, and the force generated by the biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, allowing the thread tension to be altered. The invention also provides a rapid braking action by increasing the braking force throughout the entire creel when the warping machine is shut off.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector that detects the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine. The detector includes a shaft mounted with a first, second, and third light shielding disc, which detect the needle UP position, needle DOWN position, and thread trimmer timing position, respectively.</summary>

The present invention relates to a process for producing a viscose rayon yarn with a high degree of whiteness. The process involves partial coagulation and drawing of the yarn, completion of the coagulation, washing under specific conditions, drying, and possibly finishing, resulting in a finished yarn with a degree of white not lower than 45.

<summary>
The invention relates to a small deaeration tank for use in an oxygen bleaching process. The tank is designed to deaerate pulp before it is washed, and it can be placed on top of or hung from the side of a larger tank. The deaeration tank is cylindrical in shape and has an inlet pipe for introducing pulp, an outlet for removing deaerated pulp, and a tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe. The tank is closed and can be a pressure or vacuum tank, and it is built to withstand pressures of Â±1 atmosphere. The outlet of the tank is located in the bottom plate and is sized to handle the amount of pulp leaving the tank. The inlet pipe is located above the outlet and splashes against the side wall of the tank, and the outlet is located between the inlet pipe and the bottom of the tank.
</summary>

<summary>
This invention improves upon existing composite materials by providing biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) structures with improved properties, including high structural performance and strength-to-weight ratio. The invention uses a methodology called "function-oriented material design" (FOMD) to design materials for specific tasks, such as supporting static loads or absorbing impact energy. The FOMD process involves defining functions, quantifying objectives, and considering additional constraints, such as manufacturing and cost constraints. The result is a number of innovative structural material concepts, including the BTR composite materials. The BTR composite material concept involves evenly distributing fibers in a matrix material, treating materials in tension and compression differently, and adding covering and filling materials as needed. The goal of the BTR design process is to optimize the out-plane stiffness of the composite material for a given amount of fiber and matrix materials. The optimum structural configuration of the composite includes fiber, stuffer, and joint components, with concentrated fibers along load paths for increased transverse stiffness.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a load-limiting device and method for use in a braced frame during a dynamic event. The device is designed to absorb energy and limit the loads on a structure, preventing extensive damage. The load-limiting device may be placed in a braced frame and may undergo plastic deformation during a dynamic event, preserving the structure from damage. The device may be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation with another non-plastically deformed load-limiting device.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet designed to provide a flophouse facility with a number of individual rooms on the floor of an existing building. The cabinet is composed of a hexahedron formed by four side surfaces, an upper surface, and a lower surface, and includes an outer casing and an inner casing. The outer casing is formed by an upper outer casing and a lower outer casing, while the inner casing is formed by a front surface panel, a back panel, left and right side panels, a ceiling panel, and a bottom panel. The cabinet is designed to provide a clearance between the outer casing and the inner casing, which can house electric devices such as an interphone or the like. The present invention also provides a bedroom cabinet where a clearance between an outer casing and an inner casing is formed over the whole periphery, and spacer members are interposed in the clearance in a suitably spaced relation. This design allows for an uniform air flow passage in the outer periphery of the inner casing, resulting in smooth natural ventilation within a room and increased sound-proofing effect. The bedroom cabinet of the present invention is of dual construction, consisting of the outer casing and the inner casing, and is excellent in mechanical strength. The cabinet can be closed stacked or installed adjacent to each other, and the clearance between the outer casing and the inner casing can house electric devices such as an interphone or the like without being projected within the cabinet or from the outer periphery of the outer casing.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a portable and simple guard rail system for use in erecting temporary safety barriers at construction sites. The guard rail support consists of a flat bottom plate, an upright column, and at least one guard rail support bracket. The system includes a concrete-filled steel base for use when anchoring to the floor is not possible. The guard rail support can be assembled and disassembled easily and is effective in preventing accidental falls and meeting safety guidelines. The system can be used to construct a safety barrier consisting of upper and lower wooden rails and a kick board. The fall protection tie-off ring provides retaining and attachment means for a safety cable used by workers at construction sites.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for enhanced oil recovery (EOR) using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods. The invention provides a new and novel approach to EOR by using pulsed power to create acoustic and electromagnetic vibrations that can increase the estimated ultimate recovery from reservoirs. The invention combines pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods to create a new and more effective EOR technology. The invention uses a pulsed power device to generate high-power electrical energy that is used to create acoustic and electromagnetic vibrations in the reservoir. These vibrations can increase the flow of oil from the reservoir and improve the overall recovery of hydrocarbons. The invention also provides a new and novel apparatus for EOR that uses pulsed power to create acoustic and electromagnetic vibrations in the reservoir. This apparatus can be used in a variety of EOR applications, including secondary and tertiary recovery. The invention offers several advantages over existing EOR methods, including increased efficiency, improved recovery rates, and reduced environmental impact.
</summary>

<summary>The present disclosure relates to a system and method of splicing a soil reinforcing element to extend its length in a Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structure. The splice may include a first wave plate defining one or more first transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element, and a second wave plate defining one or more second transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of a grid-strip.</summary>

In the present disclosure, the splice may be employed to lengthen the extent of a soil reinforcing element, such as the soil reinforcing element generally described above with reference to FIG. 1. The splice may couple one or more grid-strips to the soil reinforcing element, and once coupled together, the combination of the soil reinforcing element, splice, and grid-strip may be characterized or otherwise typified as a single composite soil reinforcing element for purposes of reinforcing a vertical facing into adjacent backfill.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection. The blade is constructed with basic manufacturing processes, allowing for efficient production. The invention includes a multiple component assembly, allowing for rebuilding and replacing worn blade components. The blade includes a front edge section with a void or groove formed in the front surface, and a fluid tube that travels in the void to transfer pressurized fluid from the top of the plow to the void. The fluid pressure at a certain point along the blade's length will vary, and the tube can be extended to terminate near the bottom end of the blade to maximize the volume of fluid ejected in a critical high friction area. The number and location of leading edge sections and stitch welds can be adjusted to tailor the plow for a specific application.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a building system that allows for the creation of larger and taller panels than previously possible without the need for movement control joints. The system uses a frame or substructure with studs spaced at a modular distance, battens supported from and fixed to the frame, and a plaster matrix applied in multiple layers to create a reinforced panel. The invention also provides for the reinforcement of openings in the panel with mesh or lattice-work. The system is designed to comply with New Zealand building codes and regulations, including NZS3604 and NZS4251.

The present invention relates to a new and improved safe and door structure, which provides a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening and inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls for placement of a plate-shaped separate steel door thereon. The door is engaged with the ledges and laterally displaced until the edge of the door is in abutment with a stop, and a lock assembly on the reverse side of the door has a latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement with reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt preventing transmission of force to the lock mechanism in the event of forceful intrusion attempts.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method for measuring fluid pressures in geological formations with greater accuracy. The method involves cementing a conduit in a borehole at a desired location and pressurizing the conduit to clear it of cement grout. A valve is used to prevent backflow of cement grout, and a fluid is introduced into the conduit to establish a connection between the formation and the pressure sensing device. The pressure sensing device measures the fluid pressure in the formation at the desired depth. The method isolates the pressure sensor in the borehole using a cement grout barrier, which allows for more accurate measurements of the fluid pressure in the formation.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, more specifically, a jointing structure which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter and the like, ensures high slip resistance to tires, permits less occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations and is easy to be given maintenance, and also to provide a method of mounting an elastic member therein.
The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.
The present invention is useful in applications mainly to vehicle traveling path joints in new transit systems, monorails and the like, i.e., joints of vehicle traveling paths respectively built on bridge girders as an integral part thereof, and besides, to road bed plate joints in road bridges, foot bridges and the like.
According to the present invention, it will be appreciated that even in the occurrence of any displacement such as the vertical differences in level and/or the lateral displacements and besides, the kinked joints in the joints of the bridge girders especially due to the earthquake or the like, the joint block may be conditioned to be always in the center of the expansion gap thanks to elastic member deformation for the elimination and/or relief of the differences in level and/or the lateral displacements and the like, resulting in the achievement of smooth vehicle traveling without the need for any emergency measures involving the use of the steel sheets or the like.
The elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice verse easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner. The present invention employs elastic members mainly consisting of laminated rubber.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a floor transport system that prevents contamination of a sanitary fluid treatment chamber during the transportation of wheeled hand trucks. The system includes an enclosed floor track system that segregates the wheel structure of the hand truck from the environment of the fluid treatment chamber. The track system is structured to accommodate trucks with downwardly depending struts supporting the wheel structure. The sidewalls of the wheel channel extend upwardly beyond the top of the wheel structure and include at the top edges inflatable elastomer seals that enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent entry of the brine solution into the guide track. The cover plate may be connected to the longer sidewall by a hinge, allowing it to be pivoted away from the wheel channel and facilitate cleaning. The enclosed floor track system is well adapted for use with hand trucks having horizontally axled wheel structures. The system greatly enhances the recovery and reuse of the brine solution by segregating the hand truck wheel structure from the general environment within the fluid treatment chamber.
</summary>

The present invention provides a lock device for a work machine, particularly a backhoe, which includes an engaging member and an engaged member for locking a boom of the excavating device to the main body. The lock device is constructed easily and can be operated manually by sliding the engaging member along a slot and touching a guide member, thereby preventing the engaging member from being damaged when the boom is rotated.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with an adjustable suction head. The device has a flexible platform with a central suction portion that can be adjusted in relation to the pool bottom to regulate the suction efficiency during cleaning. The adjustment is achieved through a mechanism that raises or lowers the suction portion of the platform, allowing for precise control of the suction without adjusting the suction source. The invention also includes a roller height adjustment device that can be used in combination with certain prior art suction head assemblies, allowing for easy adjustment of the suction head without major retrofitting.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from around the interior of a well head and casing. The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel and a retriever section, which is slidably movable along the mandrel and adapted to engage the wear bushing. The retriever section is designed to retrieve the wear bushing without the use of the drill bit, allowing for safe and efficient retrieval of the bushing during drilling operations.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a vibratory tool for downhole use, capable of letting a wireline or other tools pass through a central passage. The dump valve is annularly disposed around the central passage to prevent slamming against a seat during cycling. The tool has a modular piston stack that can be used in its housing, allowing for more beefy components to improve reliability. The pistons are powered by stacked pistons in the tool body, delivering more power per stroke. The tool can be run in a manner where high amplitude, low frequency oscillating forces are delivered to the stuck fish without impacts to the pistons on the housing. The mandrel is powered by the pistons, and the tool can be configured to tolerate continued downward mandrel movement to dissipate its momentum. The components are designed to apply power to the mandrel for a down cycle when the dump valve closes close to the point where the pistons reach their upward travel limit. The tool can be run to apply up oscillating forces without impacts, depending on how the tool is operated by rig personnel.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall that allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall to be transported to and assembled at the site. The invention provides a precast, substantially solid, rectangular or trapezoidal base and a face panel with an integral counterfort, which are set on grade at the job site and connected together. The wall can withstand temporary wind loads immediately after the face panel and counterfort are set on the base. The height or width of any of the individual components can vary over a wide range, and all pieces can be easily made to custom sizes. The invention also provides for proper drainage behind the wall to limit pressure and improve stability. The counterfort may have an opening for drainage near the bottom front corner, and the face panel may also have a weep hole for drainage towards the bottom. The front face panel may have more than one counterfort providing support.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well to improve production. The invention addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional down hole heating systems: inadequate heat focus and failure due to pressure invasion. The present design provides a heating unit with shielded electrical connections to prevent damage and improve flow rates. The method of the invention includes the use of a down hole heating unit with suitably shielded electrical connections and proper focus of heat on the producing formation.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a down hole tool for installing and removing objects in wells. The tool has an external pull tool or overshot that can be used in well servicing operations or an internal pull tool or spear. The tool has an expandable collet structure for establishing internal connection with an object to be pulled from the well bore. The collet structure takes the form of an outer tubular body having an inner body structure disposed in movable relation thereto. The tool has a catch mechanism with a locking position and an unlocking position, depending on the relative positions of the inner and outer body structures. The catch mechanism includes a pin structure and a control spring. The pin structure is positioned within pin receiving grooves, and the control spring ensures that the pin alternately enters one or the other of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves. The tool can be locked in relation to the down hole object by downward movement of the control line tool followed by subsequent upward movement thereof. The tool can also be unlocked by downward movement of the pulling tool, followed by subsequent upward movement thereof.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method for manufacturing a modular composed stave floor. The method includes providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm. The base and sight substrates are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means, such as dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal reinforcement means in the union plane, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means perpendicular to the union plane. The invention aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate in composed stave floors. The example embodiment provides a floor with a longer lifespan and allows for corrective maintenance without detachment. The multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal reinforcement means, provide a strong bond between the substrates. The invention also eliminates the need for applying glaze, reducing the installation time and inconvenience. The example embodiment shows that the composed stave floor does not present deformation or detachment after a period of use, and corrective maintenance can be provided to restore the floor's original properties.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a ladder attachment that improves the lateral stability of a ladder by increasing the contact area between the ladder and the work surface. The attachment includes a brace with a resilient pad that pivots to contact the work surface, providing a secure grip without damaging the surface. The invention also allows the ladder to straddle corners by pivoting the resilient pad horizontally.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a collated fastener assembly, such as nails, that are formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The invention aims to reduce the tendency for the plastic material to generate debris as the nail is driven into the workpiece. The collation system includes a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, forming a collar that captures or at least substantially encircles the shank of each fastener and a connecting portion between adjacent fasteners. The connecting portion can be formed as a bridge and a rib, with the rib having a generally cruciform shape. The invention also includes a method for making a fastener assembly, which involves arranging a plurality of fasteners in a row parallel to one another, preheating the plurality of fasteners, molding a polymer material onto the preheated fasteners, and cooling the strip to form the fastener assembly.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, comprising a bell or hood lower section and an injection button. The nozzle has an outlet shaped as a bell or hood to encapsulate rivets or screws, and an injection button with a special design for precise sealant application. The button has channels and orifices for encapsulating rivets and nuts, and allows for manual or automated sealant injection. The invention improves upon existing nozzles by providing a non-permanent connection between the button and the bell section, allowing for easy coupling and decoupling. The nozzle is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene, and is suitable for use in various industries such as aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The invention provides several advantageous and novel characteristics, representing a considerable improvement over existing nozzles. The nozzle allows for precise sealant application around rivets and nuts, and provides a connection element for coupling the button to the bell section. The invention is versatile and can be used with most cartridges or machines present in the market.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a method of reducing the number of wires required for position sensors in mechanical systems, such as internal combustion engines. The invention involves multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires using a position sensor signal conditioner and remotely electrically connected sensor monitoring equipment. The invention also provides a method of modifying a sensing signal to remove unwanted power and providing the signal to a remote monitor via two wires.

The present invention relates to a valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, particularly in automobiles. The system aims to reduce gas consumption by efficiently and effectively controlling valve port openness in conjunction with the engine's performance requirements. The invention provides a simple, robust, and infinitely variable valve actuator that can be computer-controlled for smooth operation and optimal fuel economy.

<summary>The present invention relates to aquarium lighting, specifically to LED-based aquarium lighting using a light member with a housing, a lighting control region, and one or more light-emitting modules. The light member includes a switch to control the light-emitting modules, and the modules are releasably coupled to the lighting control region to emit white or blue light.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly a gas turbine. The apparatus has a blade with a hollow airfoil section and a blade root, and a number of cooling channels through which a cooling fluid enters and flows along the insides of the hot-gas walls. The cooling fluid emerges through appropriate film-cooling openings and the separating walls are separate inserts composed of metal or non-metal materials. The invention provides a simple and efficient cooling system and avoids the disadvantages of the known apparatus, such as large amounts of material in the transitional region and thermal stresses between the insert and the hot-gas wall. The separating walls are connected by an integral material joint to the blade and the cooling channels and separating walls extend essentially in the radial direction with respect to the rotation axis of the gas turbine.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, which can be switched between manual and automatic control. The invention provides a control unit that receives a signal indicating accelerator pedal position and a signal indicating the position of the throttle valve, and processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor for controlling the throttle valve position.

<summary>
The invention relates to a waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate matter. The burner has a conical pile of waste fuel fed with preheated underfire air, which dries and gasifies the fuel. The volatile gases are discharged through a throat and enter a secondary combustion chamber where additional combustion air is introduced. The swirl air and secondary combustion air interact to maintain good separation of particulate from the gas stream, keeping it out of the secondary chamber. The burner can be used for any source of dirty particulate-laden combustible gas and can effectively burn the gas to provide a source of useful heat and remove particulate for meeting environmental emission standards. The burner has a unique aspect of being able to use a wood waste burner, but the primary and secondary chambers can be added to any source of dirty particulate-laden combustible gas. The burner includes a primary combustion chamber, a secondary combustion chamber, and a pressure isolator. The pressure isolator isolates the primary chamber from the secondary chamber combustion air, but allows free fall of separated particulate matter back into the primary chamber. The quantity of high pressure swirl air admitted to the primary chamber is varied according to the primary chamber exit temperature.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a highly efficient evaporative cooling device that provides efficient cooling by conjunction of features such as a heat exchanger that separates its dry and wet sides, evaporating water kept separate from the useful air, and a minor portion of the useful air being passed over a vapor compression refrigeration unit. The device operates by drawing most of the working air from the load, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than fresh air, and passing it through the wet side of the heat exchanger. The useful air is then passed through the dry side of the heat exchanger, which is cooled by fresh air flowing in thermal conductive contact with the outer surfaces of the tubular members. The moisture-laden return air is then exhausted from the wet side of the heat exchanger and flowed in heat exchange relationship with the fresh air before being disposed exteriorly of the device and of the enclosure. The invention provides a highly efficient apparatus for cooling air by providing a heat exchanger that separates its dry and wet sides, evaporating water kept separate from the useful air, and a minor portion of the useful air being passed over a vapor compression refrigeration unit.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a fluid pump that can handle high volumetric flow rates and high pressures. The pump has multiple pump heads connected in series to provide a single flow of fluid through each pump head. Each pump head has at least three fluid conduits to combine fluid flow from the conduits into a single flow before exiting the pump head. The pump assembly includes a support structure for mounting the pump on a vehicle or other support. The pump heads are connected by a combiner that combines fluid flow from the conduits into a single flow. The drive structure is powered by a single power source and imparts rotational motion on the impellers. The pump can be used for pumping fluids from a reservoir, such as liquid manure from a pig farm.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an engine including an engine compression release brake system. The system includes an engine housing defining a plurality of engine cylinders, and a brake body provided for each of a portion of the engine cylinders. Each brake body includes a brake actuator operably coupled to an exhaust valve actuator, and a spool valve member movable between an upward, retracted position and a downward, advanced position. The spool valve member defines a high pressure annulus that is always open to a high pressure passage, and a low pressure annulus that can connect an actuation fluid passage to a low pressure passage. When pressure communication passage is fluidly connected to a high pressure manifold, pressure within the spool cavity is high and the spool valve member is preferably hydraulically balanced and maintained in its retracted position. When pressure communication passage is fluidly connected to a low pressure reservoir, pressure within the spool cavity is low, and the high pressure acting on the high pressure surface can overcome the force of the biasing spring and move the spool valve member to its advanced position. As the spool valve member moves, a piston is moved by hydraulic pressure in the actuation fluid passage, and a lash adjuster is operably coupled to the piston via a lash screw to provide sufficient lash to accommodate thermal expansion of the components when the engine warms up.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure, such as an auxiliary gearbox. The mounting link includes a male link coupled to the engine or gearbox, a female link coupled to the engine or gearbox, and a pin releasably coupling the male link to the female link. The female link receives the male link to allow translation of the male link relative to the female link and to form a radial interface, which dampens translation of the male link relative to the female link. The pin selectively retains the male link and the female link, allowing the links to translate relative to each other after an event that causes the pin to shear.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to archery equipment and provides a small, lightweight point cap system that can be adjusted for perfect balance. The invention also provides a balance pin that can be trimmed to the desired length and used with an arrow shaft to achieve perfect balance. The point cap system and balance pin design work together to provide a balanced arrow, and the invention also provides a means of attachment that is suited to the use of unidirectional fiber-reinforced shafts.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to military weapons and simulators, particularly the simulation of small arms fire without modifying the weapon. The invention utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system. The expendable contains multiple rounds and is installed in a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech. The invention produces sound and flash by electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion produced through the weapon's ejection port. The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semi-automatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt. The invention is designed to provide a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash without dangerous pressuration of the ignition chamber. The circuitry of the Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) consists of ten functional blocks, including a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, firing counter, firing decoder, firing sensors, and a Multiple Integrated Laser Engagement System (MILES) interface. The invention utilizes a 10 Hertz oscillator and a 500 Hertz oscillator to provide the firing signal, and a firing control that utilizes a D flip-flop, a NAND gate, and an inverter to clock the 500 Hertz oscillator and provide the firing signal to the pyrotechnic.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that improves performance by utilizing dynamic effects. The device includes a tank, a first pipe, and a second pipe interconnected by a valve. The valve is activated by an engine operating condition and opens or shuts the valve in response. The cross-sectional area of the second pipe is smaller than that of the first pipe, and the valve is located nearer the air cleaner than the location where the first pipe opens to the intake passage. The invention improves engine performance by reducing noise from the air intake and utilizing the dynamic effects of the air flow. The valve is operated based on the engine load and speed, and the valve operating conditions are stored in a control circuit. The invention also reduces noise from the air intake by providing a narrow passage in the pipe interconnected with the tank.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a bracket for mounting speakers or other equipment to a pole or other surface. The bracket consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket that can be attached to the object to be mounted. The adjustable bracket is then positioned on the stationary bracket to mount the object on the surface or pole. The bracket assembly includes two major components: a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket. The stationary bracket is attached to the mounting surface, while the adjustable bracket is attached to the product that requires directional positioning. The adjustable bracket is rotated into a locked position, and the two mount halves snap together without tools or hardware. The bracket assembly is specifically designed for one person to install a fairly heavy item. The installer never needs to support the weight of the object and handle attachment hardware simultaneously. The invention provides a simple and economic solution for mounting a product on a pole or column, and it can also be used on walls without the pole adapters. The bracket assembly includes pole clamp assembly, which consists of two adapter brackets with stepped teeth attached to the stationary bracket. The adjustable bracket is securely screwed to the speaker, and the assembly is then easily mounted on the stationary bracket to mount the speaker to a pole or other surface.
</summary>

<summary>
The present disclosure relates to a burner and modular heat utilizing appliances. The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder. Air flows through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and also around the fuel holder to be directed to flame and fumes just above the fuel holder to support secondary combustion. The burner has legs holding the combustion chamber well above ground level, and a pivotally coupled ash pan. A perforate food grill is pivotally coupled to the burner, and is movable to a deployed position above the flame, and to a stowed position to the side of the combustion chamber and associated outer walls. Opposite the perforate food grill, a cover is pivotally coupled to the burner, enabling the combustion chamber to be closed to prevent inadvertent ingress of dropped items, inadvertent exposure of the user to heat and exhaust fumes, and to suppress escape of live embers. The burner has manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances thereto.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a combustion engine, particularly a rotary internal combustion engine, and aims to provide an ignition and cooling system combination that maintains efficient combustion while improving cooling characteristics to reduce the possibility of structural failure. The invention provides a housing structure for a rotary internal combustion engine that facilitates circumferential cooling flow in the rotor housing while permitting the interruption of spark plug bosses therethrough. The housing is structured to minimize thermal distortion, particularly in the zone surrounding the spark plug bosses. The invention also provides a flow diverter or flow controller between the spark plug bosses to ensure a controlled flow regime between the bosses and for strengthening the housing structure. The invention improves the heat transfer coefficient of the cooling circuit at the spark plug boss zone by at least 20% over prior art capabilities.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance during periodic operational testing of turbine control valves. The method uses control valve positions as feedback to compensate for flow changes caused by valve closure. The flow characteristic for each valve is determined during design, and the flow difference between N and N-1 valves is known. The flow change due to valve closure is calculated, and the total mass flow demand is adjusted to maintain a constant flow through the remaining valves. The invention improves turbine power stability and reduces steam boiler pressure changes during testing.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, wherein the valve provides a proportional mixture of the two fluids by adjusting a valve means within the valve body. The valve system includes a valve body with a first inlet passage, a second inlet passage, and an outlet passage, and a valve member received within the valve body for directing the fluid mixture.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method includes compressing the gas delivered to the pipeline with an entry pressure, subsequently cooling it by a heat exchange, and feeding it to the pipeline with a lower exit temperature. The invention also provides for expanding the compressed gas to obtain the desired exit pressure. The compressor station includes at least one compressor, heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, and control units. The invention utilizes the known physical effect that a compressed gas is cooled when expanded to a lower pressure, and provides a more significant cooling effect by expanding the compressed gas with simultaneous work. The invention also provides for exchanging the compressors used in the stages, which can be done because the requirements for the rate of flow through the pipeline and the environmental conditions for cooling by heat exchange are subject to substantial changes during the course of the year.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a cooling fan mounting system that eliminates the need for fasteners traditionally used to secure cooling fans to an enclosure. The system includes a motor housing with resilient legs that are urged away from the panel by spring members, and a plurality of mounting legs that are coupled to the motor housing and terminate into a recess portion of the panel. The resilient legs are designed to urge the motor housing away from the panel once the mounting legs are in their fully seated position, preventing the motor housing from moving due to vibrational forces. The system provides a secure and vibration-free mounting of the cooling fan to the panel, and eliminates the need for fasteners, which can be time-consuming and costly to install.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a damped instrument kinematic mount used to improve the performance of precision instruments in space missions. The mount incorporates novel damping features to minimize loads transmitted to the instrument during launch and vibration. Two preferred embodiments of the damper design are described, including a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper. The damper designs introduce damping into the six mount suspension modes, dissipating vibration energy into heat and reducing loads on the instrument. The damping mechanism is placed at machined hinge or flexure locations of the mounts, and the designs are tailored to provide appropriate damping levels.
