The invention achieves its objects by providing a kinematic mount that incorporates novel damping features, and slightly rearranging the six strut configuration to approximately uncouple the mount suspension modes. The device can be applied to a large number of precision or optical instruments where alignment stability is important.
</summary>

The invention relates to a novel and improved clutch unit for large size power transmission applications, particularly in aircraft catapult systems. The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, an output shaft, interleaved clutch plates and discs, and separate means for closing the gap between each disc and its adjacent clutch plate. The unit utilizes hydraulic fluid for dual purposes, including retracting the plate actuating means and as a coolant for the clutch discs.

<summary>
The invention relates to a combustion engine with multiple cylinders, wherein downstream expansion cylinders are associated with a combustion cylinder to provide a surface area and volumetric displacement sufficient to lower the temperature of fluids associated with the engine, such that a radiator can be eliminated. Water is recovered from a system having both a water injection expansion cylinder and a combustion cylinder, and is re-used for the expansion. Gearing is provided between an expansion cylinder and a combustion cylinder to optimize the output of the combined engine and eliminate the need for a single-to-one gear reduction.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a fabrication process for plates or blanks of coated steel intended to be welded and then heat treated to obtain parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance. The invention aims to eliminate the source of intermetallic areas that can lead to rupture during welding and heat treatment. The proposed solution involves removing a portion of the initial surface pre-coating on either side of the future welded joint, which reduces the risk of intermetallic area formation. The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is between 0.2 and 2.2 mm, and the thickness of the intermetallic alloy layer is between 3 and 10 micrometers. The area from which the metal alloy has been removed is produced by partly eliminating the metal alloy layer on at least one precoated face of the plate by brushing or laser beam. The present invention also provides a welded blank obtained by butt-welding at least two plates according to a preferred embodiment of the present invention, and a part obtained by heat treatment and deformation of the welded blank. The composition of the steel used in the invention includes, by weight: 0.10%â¦Câ¦0.5%, 0.5%â¦Mnâ¦3%, 0.1%â¦Siâ¦1%, 0.01%â¦Crâ¦1%, Tiâ¦0.2%, Alâ¦0.1%, Sâ¦0.05%, Pâ¦0.1%, and 0.0005%â¦Bâ¦0.010%.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a remote control system and algorithm for supervisory control and data acquisition in an offshore energy recovery system. The system includes an offshore mobile structure that extracts energy from weather patterns, and a remote control system that navigates the mobile structure to optimize energy extraction. The remote control system uses an algorithm that takes into account data from weather satellites, GPS, and other sources to optimize the position and velocity of the mobile structure. The system also includes a computer server that gathers data from various sources and runs human machine interface software applications. The present invention applies to any mobile structure that extracts energy from weather patterns, and is not limited to the Turbine-Integrated Hydrofoil system of U.S. Pat. No. 7,298,056. The system can also be used for logistics-only purposes past weather patterns.
</summary>

The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage and a method for manufacturing the same. The cage is composed of a ring element produced from a sheet metal material and several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction. The ring element is composed of at least three flat material ring segments joined together in succession in the circumferential direction and welded along edge regions. The joint contours of the ring segments engage positively in one another, forming an undercut geometry that preliminarily couples the segments.

<summary>
The present invention relates to methods and systems for obtaining information associated with a customer's service location. The methods and systems include requesting at least one set of coordinates associated with the customer service location, accessing a technician server to direct a global satellite positioning system to obtain the set of coordinates, and updating one or more databases with the coordinates. The coordinates may include at least one of a latitude and a longitude associated with the customer service location. The methods and systems also include generating directions for a service technician traveling from a first customer service location to at least a second customer service location.

The invention provides a technician server for receiving data transmissions from an input device at the customer service location. The technician server is in communication with a global positioning satellite system for determining a set of coordinates associated with the input device. The invention also includes a mapping system operatively associated with the input device for generating travel directions based on the "from" and "to" coordinates.

The methods and systems of the present invention provide efficient and effective customer service by obtaining information associated with a customer's service location, such as their latitude and longitude coordinates. This information can be used to direct a service technician to the customer's location with little or no time lost searching for the service location. The invention also provides a technician server for receiving and processing information related to providing service at a customer service location, and a mapping system for generating travel directions based on the "from" and "to" coordinates.

The invention includes a protocol server that receives and processes communications from both a wireless data network and a landline server. The protocol server processes information transmitted from the input device, including a user ID, password, radio serial number, input device serial number, and other similar data associated with a service technician and service provided at a customer service location.

The technician server is configured and programmed to verify and/or process information received from the input device, and functions as a transaction request broker between the protocol server and one or more other systems operatively connected to the technician server. The systems operatively associated with the technician server include a global positioning satellite system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer records system.

The invention also includes a GPS system that can be employed to track, dispatch, and monitor service technicians and their input devices at numerous customer

<summary>
The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields. The system comprises two real magnetic field sensors, a control unit, and six coils. The control unit receives the output signals of the sensors and combines them to create a virtual sensor signal. The virtual sensor signal is then processed by a control algorithm to generate control signals for the coils. The system is designed to compensate for both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields. The invention also addresses the problem of feedback effects when using multiple magnetic field compensation systems in close proximity. The system is designed to equalize feedback effects and provide a more accurate compensation.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method for investigating a sample using CARS microscopy, which involves generating a resonance signal by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering of a sample by means of laser irradiation and sensing the signal in image-producing fashion. The invention aims to provide a method that can furnish at least one resonance site in a sample by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner. The method involves introducing a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner, which can be used to generate resonance sites in the sample. The present invention makes it possible to use small molecules that can be introduced deep into a corresponding tissue, since no steric hindrance occurs and they diffuse through a tissue. Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without appreciably interfering with natural processes. Typical bioorthogonal reactions include 1,3-dipolar cycloaddition between azides and cyclooctynes, reaction between nitrones and cyclooctynes, oxime/hydrate formation from aldehydes and ketones, tetrazine reactions, isonitrile-based click reactions, and quadricyclane formation.
</summary>

The present invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, including clinician-approved segmentations and those generated by autosegmentation programs. The system compares the segmentations using a metric method to evaluate their quality and identify areas of error, providing an intuitive display form that can be rapidly assessed by an individual with minimal training.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a data processing system and its apparatus for executing floating point operations. The invention aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit. The apparatus includes a difference between operand exponent arguments determination and a subset difference apparatus that provides a result prior to the availability of the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments. The procedures are chosen such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset operand argument difference, the correct result fraction is one of the operand fractions, a quantity that is available. The invention improves the floating point execution by providing two procedures into which the effective subtraction operations are divided to accelerate their execution.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method and system for tracking a specimen acquired from a patient. The method involves storing machine-readable codes in a computer storage, selecting a specimen container with a unique machine-readable code, and reading the machine-readable codes to determine if the specimen is from the correct patient. The method also includes determining if the specimen container is out-of-date and generating an alert signal if necessary. The processor of the computer stores the machine-readable codes in a relational manner and generates a signal to acquire the specimen and place it in the container. An indication of the specimen being placed in the container is also stored in the computer storage. The method can further include storing additional machine-readable codes in the computer storage and generating signals to acquire additional specimens.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a voice activated distance measuring device for golfers. The device uses GPS technology and voice recognition software to provide distance and other information to the user. The device may also accept verbal or other data input and memorize and compute this information to predict golf course user golf strategy. The device may be used for other applications such as hiking, surveyors, and hunters, and may be expanded to include its use in any portable application. The device may be connected to a separate personal computer for detailed functions such as graphical display of the user's score and plot of all ball trajectories. The device may be used to record geographic coordinates of a golf course, including its hazards and fairway boundaries, using a portable computing device equipped with a GPS device. The recorded course data may be used to calculate geographic distances between the golfer's current GPS position and course features, and may be used for other purposes such as information for greens keepers.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention provides a solution to the disadvantages of conventional design rule checking methods in the semiconductor industry. The invention applies the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data, based on modifying standard logic rules to reflect the needs of particular regions in the chip. The customized design rules are created for each different type of region that may be present on the chip, and are used to check a design in GDS form. The design rule checker uses one or more rules from the set to check different areas of an IC layout, depending on the types of regions presented in the IC. The result is that a design rule check result includes a number of separate error reports for layout violations detected in a layer of an IC. The invention eliminates the necessity for manual checking and reduces the possibility of false errors.
</summary>

The invention relates to a method for selectively illuminating demanding objects, such as holograms and spatial light modulators, using thin substrate waveguides. The illumination system comprises a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser, and can provide extremely high diffraction efficiencies with repetitive diffraction of light out of the waveguide in the direction of propagation.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing rotors of dynamoelectric machines, such as electric motors and generators. The test apparatus includes a test head for accepting and causing relative angular movement between the rotor and test head, and exciting means for magnetizing the rotor during such angular movement in response to an alternating current. The apparatus also includes voltage sensing means for generating a voltage signal responsive to the magnetic flux variations generated by the rotor in response to the magnetization, and current sensing means for sensing the magnitude of the alternating current utilized to magnetize the rotor and generating a current signal representative thereof. Processing means are provided for determining the resistance and reactance of the rotor responsive to the voltage signal and current signal. In addition, skew sensing means may be provided for sensing the effective electrical skew of the rotor and generating an effective skew signal responsive thereto. The processing means is usable for determining an effective electrical skew of the rotor responsive to the effective skew signal.
</summary>

<summary>
The present disclosure relates to a method for securing a computing device by granting access to native resources of an operating system based on validated digital certificates associated with managed libraries. The method includes receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library, authorizing the request based on the validated digital certificate, and denying access to the native system resource if the digital certificate is not validated. The method also includes receiving a package from a networked computer system, identifying an executable in the package, verifying managed metadata associated with the executable, and sending a request to access the native system resource to a runtime host.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a low-cost, easily constructed identification card with an antenna and chip incorporated into the body of the card. The card contains two rigid outer layers and a core layer with an antenna and chip. The core layer is made of a silica-filled polyolefin and has a first side and a second side. The antenna is fixed to the first side of the core layer, and the chip is electrically connected to the antenna. The card also contains a bottom sheet and a first laminate layer. The bottom sheet is attached to the second side of the core layer, and the first laminate layer is attached to the bottom sheet. The invention provides an improved identification card with enhanced protection against external stresses and bending.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a method for implementing a memory, specifically a functional memory, for storing data in a queue. The invention provides a novel way of establishing a queue by means of a tree-shaped structure in which the nodes have a given maximum size. The addition and deletion of data units are directed to the first non-full node, seen from below, on the first edge of the data structure. The tree-shaped data structure is maintained in such a way that the leaf nodes remain at the same hierarchy level of the tree. The updates are made in a logarithmically dependent time and space on the length of the queue.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to embedded EPROM devices built using existing IC manufacturing technologies. The invention provides EPROM devices for DRAM redundancy circuits and supports other applications such as programmable firmware on logic circuits. The novel device structures utilize existing circuit elements to build EPROM devices without complicating existing manufacture technologies. The invention provides EPROM devices manufactured by standard logic technologies without requiring high voltages for its operations. The current art EPROM devices are not manufacturable using current art DRAM manufacturing technologies, but the present invention overcomes this limitation.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a technique for determining the optimal values of feedback gain used in feedback control. The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain, executing feedback control, detecting an error, calculating an evaluation value, repeating the process multiple times, and calculating a feedback gain value that provides a suitable evaluation value. The proportional gain is evaluated based on the length of a curve obtained by plotting the error against the time axis, while the integral gain is evaluated based on the integral of the error. The differential gain is evaluated based on the integral of the absolute value of the error. The present invention provides a method for determining the optimal values of the P, I, and D gains in a short period of time and regardless of the type of subject being controlled.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a zoom lens that can achieve a small F-number, high zoom ratio, and a standard image angle at the wide angle end while maintaining high optical performance throughout the entire zoom range. The invention comprises a first lens unit for focusing, a second lens unit for varying the image magnification, a third lens unit for compensating for image plane shift, a fourth lens unit for making the light beam almost afocal, and a fixed fifth lens unit for image formation. The invention satisfies certain conditions for the construction and arrangement of the elements in the fourth and fifth lens units to correct aberrations and achieve good optical performance throughout the zoom range. The fourth and fifth lens units are constructed in a specific form to correct residual aberrations. Four examples of specific zoom lenses of the invention are provided in the tables.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons or the like in a detector. The invention aims to provide a method and device that can detect both individual particles and integrate count rates, without knowing in advance count or signal rates to be expected. The method according to the invention provides discharging of a charge pulse or signal from the detector on the low-voltage side, and both an amplification of individual signals in a fast amplifier and an integration of each of a plurality of signals in a second, slow amplifier. The invention also proposes the use of a method according to the invention or a preferred embodiment thereof, or a device according to the invention or a preferred embodiment thereof, for detecting particles in particle accelerators, in reactor installations, in diagnostic devices such as X-ray devices, CT devices or the like.

<summary>
The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking a driven disc assembly. The apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring slidably supported thereon. A torque motor is provided with an output shaft connected to a splined hub, upon which the driven disc assembly is mounted for rotation between the two rings. Means are provided for selectively moving the movable ring toward the stationary ring so as to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly therebetween. The distance separating the two rings is measured by an electronic sensor, and the torque motor is energized to exert a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly. The movable ring is gradually moved away from the stationary ring, and the distance separating the two rings is measured again. If the distance is within acceptable tolerances, the driven disc assembly is determined to be good. If the distance is beyond acceptable tolerances, the driven disc assembly is determined to be bad.
</summary>

<summary>
The present disclosure relates to a method of generating a face age-estimation for a face represented by first image data as a function of faces represented by second image data and having assigned landmark points and known ages. The method includes receiving the first image data, applying a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to generate a first feature vector, executing an age classifier on the first feature vector to identify an estimated age group for the face represented by the first image data as a function of the assigned landmark points of the second image data, and applying an aging function to the first feature vector to generate the face age-estimation as a function of the assigned landmark points of the second image data.
The present invention is directed to a method of face age-estimation, which includes extracting facial features from an image of a test subject and mapping the facial features to one of at least two differing age groups having corresponding differently calibrated mapping functions. The invention also relates to a machine-readable storage medium containing machine executable instructions for performing a method of face age-estimation.
The drawings illustrate a face age-estimation training method and a corresponding method of face age-estimation, which include steps and/or machine-readable instructions for estimating an age of a person represented in first image data. The present inventors have discovered that verification rates for image-based face age-estimation can be greatly improved by performing a contourlet transform on the first image data and by classifying the subject face according to aging mechanisms.
The method of face age-estimation includes applying a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to the first image data to generate a first feature vector, executing an age classifier on the first feature vector to identify an estimated age group for the face represented by the first image data as a function of the assigned landmark points of the second image data, and applying an aging function to the first feature vector to generate the face age-estimation as a function of the assigned landmark points of the second image data.
The present disclosure is directed to a method of generating a face age-estimation for a face represented by first image data as a function of faces represented by second image data and having assigned landmark points and known ages. The method includes receiving the first image data, applying a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to generate

<summary>
The present invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images. The device includes a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements of pixels. Each arrangement includes a plurality of pixels, with some pixels dedicated to displaying a first image and others dedicated to displaying a second image. The device produces a merged display of the two images, which may be redimensioned as necessary. The invention aims to overcome the limitations of prior art display devices by proposing a matrix display device that can implement algorithms more easily and efficiently.
</summary>

The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for a keyless activation of a security system of a motor vehicle, which possesses an enlarged functionality and has a simple design. The payment element can be removed from the housing of the identification transmitter by the user, and the closure protects and seals the receptacle. The invention also includes a configuration wherein via a conscious activation of the identification transmitter, the payment element and/or the carrier can be removed from the receptacle by the user.

<summary>
The present disclosure relates to a method and apparatus for charging a developer in an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine. The method and apparatus are designed to address problems associated with the tribo charge of toner, which can affect the image quality of the developed image. The disclosure includes an inactivity determining section that determines the inactivity of the imaging device and a charging section that charges the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined inactivity. The charging section may also include a toner concentration sensor that monitors the concentration of the mixed toner and developer and sends a signal to a controller to increase the supply of toner if the concentration is low.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can independently and precisely regulate the bias currents supplied to multiple magneto resistive heads mounted on a rotary drum. The invention provides a recording/reproducing apparatus that can switch over plural heads with high precision, particularly a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can switch over plural MR heads and recording heads mounted on a rotary drum at high speed.

<summary>
The invention relates to a system and method for locating concealed objects, such as pipes or cables, in the presence of an adjacent object. The transmitter employs a pair of antennae to induce a pair of distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, respectively. The receiver senses magnetic fields associated with the currents and produces an output signal dependent upon the sensing of both fields. The invention improves the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing a buried pipe or cable in the presence of an adjacent object. The system produces two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables, allowing for easier and more accurate tracing. The transmitter may be positioned optimally relative to the cables for improved tracing operations. The invention uses a pair of antennae driven by RF signals to induce corresponding distinguishable currents in cables. The orientation of the antennae may be changed to enhance the inducement of currents in the respective cables.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a two-way speaker device with a telephone network. The apparatus includes a source of power, selective switch means, and a coupler for automatically coupling the telephone network to the speaker device to receive incoming telephone calls. The interfacer device includes an optocoupler for coupling the telephone ringing circuit, a timer for limiting the time duration during which the telephone network is coupled to the speaker phone, and a reset switch for canceling the predetermined time cycle in the timer. The invention provides a simplified, portable, and readily connectable automatic answering service for telephone communication in a hands-free manner.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing them with remotely pumped optical amplifiers. The invention utilizes a branch fiber optic cable to transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than signal wavelength to the remote optical amplifier for signal amplification. The hub assemblies are optically connected via a telecommunications cable trunk in a ring topology, with cable stations extracting and inserting trunk communication signals through branch fiber optic cables. The invention respects sovereignty concerns in undersea communications networks and accommodates reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units. The repeaterless technology incorporating remote pumping of an optical energy source through the network's branch fiber optic cables may reduce capital costs and operating and maintenance costs of communications networks. The invention can be applied to both undersea and terrestrial communications systems. The preferred embodiment consists of four branch assemblies, a hub assembly with remote pumping, and a hub assembly without remote pumping, serially coupled by an optical fiber cable trunk in a ring topology.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices. The device consists of a two-part construction, with the first part installed over the wiring device and the second part installed without visible fasteners. The cover plate device has a flat, smooth surface and no visible fasteners when installed. The device is designed to accommodate variations in the flatness or evenness of the wall and can be easily installed or removed. The invention provides a cover plate device that is quickly and easily installed using simple tools and available fasteners, and can be properly positioned over wiring devices installed in a wall that is not flat or even.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, which consists of a plurality of annular strips concentrically nested and essentially enclosing one another in a tight manner. The strips are suitable to be fixed in front of a displaying screen and in that case surround the screen, and can be folded-in and folded-out of the light-shielding device. The device consists of as few parts as possible, is inexpensive to produce, operates reliably, and can easily be fitted to a monitor. The strips have a decreasing wall thickness, viewed in the axial direction, which allows the device to be set to various angular positions relative to the screen, making it possible to view the displaying screen from various angles. The invention provides an adapter member providing a flat attachment face for the light-shielding device, which can be attached to a monitor with an elastically deformable material. The device can be modified by bending plate material with integrated hooks or locking elements, or by using a plate-shaped annular strip with a bent profile section.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention discloses a solution to automatically inform a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when it exceeds a rate that a listener can understand. The invention includes a method for facilitating comprehension during a discourse, a device for facilitating understanding between discourse participants, and a method for automatically notifying a speaker to decrease their speaking rate. The device can monitor the rate of speech during a discourse and provide an indicator warning the speaker to slow down when the speaking rate exceeds a listening rate. The invention can be implemented in various aspects, including a method performed at least in part by a service agent and/or a machine manipulated by a service agent in response to a service request. The device can include a microphone, a sensory mechanism, a speaking rate processor, a language detector, a speech clarity processor, and a wireless transceiver. The invention can also include a speaking rate threshold and a language proficiency level.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a device for optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam, to make the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane on which the processes are optically projected.
The device includes a cyclic line counter, which carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses respectively, N/p being an integer >1, the end-of-count pulse being applied to the beam suppression circuit of the TV camera for picture beam suppression.
The device also includes a sawtooth generator synchronized with the output pulses of the counter and to control the vertical deviation of the beam.
The device can be used to record TV pictures with a higher picture sequence frequency than a conventional TV system, by means of simple means and in a very flexible way.
The device can be used to record TV pictures with a higher picture sequence frequency than a conventional TV system, by means of simple means and in a very flexible way.
The device can be used to record TV pictures with a higher picture sequence frequency than a conventional TV system, by means of simple means and in a very flexible way.
The device can be used to record TV pictures with a higher picture sequence frequency than a conventional TV system, by means of simple means and in a very flexible way.
The device can be used to record TV pictures with a higher picture sequence frequency than a conventional TV system, by means of simple means and in a very flexible way.
The device can be used to record TV pictures with a higher picture sequence frequency than a conventional TV system, by means of simple means and in a very flexible way.
The device can be used to record TV pictures with a higher picture sequence frequency than a conventional TV system, by means of simple means and in a very flexible way.
The device can be used to record TV pictures with a higher picture sequence frequency than a conventional TV system, by means of simple means and in a very flexible way.
The device can be used to record TV pictures with a higher picture sequence frequency than a conventional TV system, by means of simple means and in a very flexible way.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to multimedia communications and provides a solution for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions in a packet-based network. The invention provides a blended call system that allows a single session to include both voice and multimedia components, which are handled by a multimedia server with blender software. The blender software receives incoming calls and directs the call components to the appropriate device. The invention also provides a method for determining if a call is a blended call and refers the call to the blender software if it is. The blender software controls the bearer paths associated with the call and passes the voice call component back to the telephony server for redirection or looping. The invention is well suited for use with a Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T) configuration and can integrate with existing network devices.</summary>

The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework that allows connected devices to perform contextual synchronization over various communication network topologies. The framework provides a central reference point for synchronization and supports both synchronous and asynchronous interaction between the central reference point and connected devices.

The present invention provides a system for facilitating communication between a finder of an object and an owner of the object, where the system includes a unique ID associated with the object, a database for storing the owner's contact information, and a module for forwarding communications from the finder to the owner. The system allows for a timely and anonymous communication channel between the finder and the owner, without requiring the finder to have access to the owner's personal information.

The present invention relates to an electron multiplier that uses a series of thin foils to multiply electrons in a series of transmission stages. The foils are held in an evacuated enclosure and a voltage is applied to each foil to accelerate electrons emitted from the back of one foil to an energy level that effectively transmits the electrons through the next foil in the series. The present invention may be used for amplification of an incident electron flux or for detection of particles.

The invention relates to a system that allows almost any motion picture to be viewed effortlessly with the visual effect of 3-dimensions. The 3-D Phenomenoscope uses a computer algorithm to calculate in real-time, from a multiplicity of media frames, the synchronization and control events. The preferred embodiment has no moving parts and no wire connections, and uses material that partially occludes or entirely clears in response to electronic signals. The 3-dimensional visual effect is produced regardless of whether the motion picture was shot on regular or digital film, or whether it is viewed in a movie theater, home TV, or on a PC monitor. The invention uses a Pulfrich effect with a darkened lens to create the 3-dimensional illusion. The Pulfrich spectacles have one clear lens that does not cause a delay and one darkened lens that causes a delay. The delay between the two lenses allows the brain to triangulate the image and perceive depth.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die from the wafer without using a wafer saw. The method includes forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer and applying mechanical pressure to the wafer to singulate the individual die. The invention provides a faster and more efficient way to singulate semiconductor wafers compared to traditional wafer sawing methods. The trenches are etched along the horizontal and vertical scribe lines on the wafer surface, and the adhesive tape is placed on the back surface of the wafer. Pressure is then applied to the back surface of the wafer to break along the trenches, singulating the dice on the wafer. The invention can be used for any sized wafer or type of die, and the trenches may be formed by partially cutting the wafer using a wafer saw or by etching. The trenches could also be formed on the bottom or non-active surface of the wafer.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a field emission display panel or device, and more particularly, to a field emission display device having at least one reduction plate or electrode that deflects ionic emission gas away from the field emission components of the device to prevent damage to the field emission components. The invention aims to provide a novel protection structure for preventing burn-out damage to field emission elements in a field emission display device. The protection structure may include multiple reduction plates or electrodes interspersed among field emission elements on a cathode in the device to alter the discharge path of ionized gases and prevent electrical surging that may cause burnout damage to field emission elements. The invention also provides a novel field emission display device with a protection structure that prevents the gases from inducing an electrical surge that may cause burnout damage to field emission elements in the device. The protection structure may be used in a field emission display device with microtips or a diode structure using nanotube emitters as the electron emission sources. The invention can be fabricated at lower cost and higher efficiency than conventional FEDs using microtips. The protection structure can improve the quality of the field emission display device and prevent electrical surging and burnout damage to field emission elements.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an image sensor that includes multiple imaging planes. The image sensor comprises a semiconductor substrate with opposed major surfaces and edges between them. An edge surface of the substrate includes an image sensor element that includes a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region. The image sensor element functions with the top imaging plane, and the substrate includes a bottom layer that is highly doped with a P-type material and an upper layer that is more lightly doped with a P-type material. The image sensor can be used to image in a plurality of planes, allowing it to be used in many image formats, such as imaging two opposing surfaces or the surface imaging of passageways.
</summary>

The present invention relates to networks, particularly home networks, and provides methods for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device to minimize power consumption while ensuring optimal network administration. The invention advantageously addresses the need for a power management system that can transfer network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device when the master device enters power save mode, while ensuring that the best qualified slave device is promoted to the master role.

<summary>
The invention relates to an antenna array for radio interferometric techniques, which consists of at least four antennas spaced to provide two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane. The array measures the elevation angle of a radio wave arriving from a remote source and of the ground reflection coefficient. The array operates in a receive mode or transmit mode, where the transmitted signal from each antenna must be coded to enable a quotient representing angle to be derived in a remote receiver. The array consists of three triplets, each with different spacings and heights above the ground plane. The triplets are used to obtain a quotient signal, which is a function of the elevation angle but not of the ground reflection coefficient. The quotient signal is then divided by the same value to provide a measure of the elevation angle. The invention overcomes the ambiguity of the angle measurement by using a common coherent carrier for the transmissions from each element of a triplet.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a subminiature lamp assembly that combats the problems of conventional subminiature lamps, such as high temperature polymer direct support, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack. The invention utilizes a high temperature polymer that directly surrounds and is in compression contact with the glass envelope, and may be manually handled and used to manipulate the subminiature lamp. The elastomer used for the seal supported lamp assembly provides extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack. The invention also includes a potting material such as pourable silicone that helps to stabilize the electrical leads and provide additional support to the glass envelope. The subminiature lamp assembly of the present invention utilizes a polymeric supporting cover fitted over the subminiature lamp glass envelope and over at least a portion of the subminiature lamp base. The invention provides a much longer bulb life by combating the above mechanisms of bulb degradation, and provides further protection from burns for users, regardless of the type of appliance in which the bulb is used.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a technique for configuring a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) based precoder in a multi-user Multiple-Input Multiple-Output (MU-MIMO) wireless system. The invention aims to reduce the computational cost of the precoder while maintaining the same performance as the conventional GDFE precoder. The proposed method does not require knowledge of the covariance matrix corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise," which is a key component in the conventional design of the GDFE precoder. The invention provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE precoder and does not require channel reduction when the input covariance matrix for the downlink channel is rank deficient. The proposed method achieves significant improvement in computational cost over conventional GDFE precoders. The invention can be applied to various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including planned future "4G" cellular networks.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, wherein an sidewall of the housing extends outwards to enlarge the intake airflow area without modifying the assembling conditions between the existing fan and other heat dissipation elements. The shape of the housing at the air outlet side is kept unchanged in order to enhance the heat-dissipating efficiency of the fan. The fan may be mounted to a system or other heat dissipation elements without changing the assembling conditions with the system and the heat dissipation elements. According to the invention, the housing includes an outer frame having a passage for guiding air streams to flow from an opening to another opening, wherein an sidewall of the passage extends radially outwardly so as to enlarge intake or discharge area for the air streams. Preferably, the sidewall of the passage is formed with an inclined portion or a beveled edge therearound. The invention also relates to a heat-dissipating system including a casing, at least one electrical element mounted within the casing, and a heat-dissipating device mounted on the casing for dissipating heat generated from the at least one electrical element when it operates.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display different colors according to the situation without using an intermediate electrode. The panel consists of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including a first electrode, an insulation layer, a first luminescent layer, a second luminescent layer, and a second electrode. The first luminescent layer is made of a material that emits light without red components, while the second luminescent layer is made of a material that emits light with red components. The panel can display different colors by changing the voltage level, and the green light display is suitable for use as an instrument panel for an automobile.
</summary>

The present invention relates to a communications terminal for internet/network telephony that uses a network and/or the Internet for transferring information/data representing digitized speech, sounds, music, etc. The terminal includes audio means for reproducing sound and recording sound, converting means for converting the recorded sound into transmission data, and protocol means for handling and controlling communication of the transmission data in accordance with a standardized internet/network protocol. The terminal also includes wireless communications means for wireless near field communication of the transmission data and a connecting unit for establishing a connection to a network and/or the Internet. The terminal provides telephony via a network or the Internet, which gives a considerable economic advantage.

<summary>
The invention relates to a method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry. The method involves growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide on a semiconductor substrate, and then depositing a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide on the buffer layer. The non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide is less than about 10 nm thick, and the Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide is grown on the buffer layer. A second non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide layer may be grown on top of the Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide, and a conducting layer may be grown on the second non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide layer. The non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide is preferably barium strontium titanate, and the Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide is lead zirconate titanate.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a receiver input circuit that enables substantial elimination of undesired signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, resulting in distortions. The circuit comprises a control loop for amplification control, with the control signal being derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to the part of the circuit preceding the mixer stage, in addition to a second amplification control loop. The third amplification control loop has a lower response threshold and frequency bandwidth than the first and second control circuits. The invention aims to provide a receiver input circuit that can substantially eliminate undesired signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, resulting in distortions, while taking into account adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components. The circuit is designed to provide better protection of the input circuit from negative influences of stronger spurious signals, while also affording better selectivity of the input circuit compared to adjacent signal frequency bands.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to network-implemented shared workspace environments and provides a method and apparatus for simple spontaneous setup of a shared workspace between physically distant individuals. The invention provides a system for initiating a collaborative work-share environment between two or more parties to a telephone call without complex setup processes. The telephone is used in the usual way to make regular voice-only calls, and once the call is established, the parties can share information between themselves, conduct video conferences, etc., while maintaining their initial voice connection. The collaboration indicator is lit on the telephone set when the parties can collaborate, and the collaboration button is pushed to initiate collaboration. The system then determines if the parties have the capability of collaborating and launches the collaboration application if possible. The invention also provides a generalized architecture for implementing network collaboration between multiple parties.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method for optimizing the visual impact of an advertising clip inserted into a video sequence. The method accounts for the regions of interest of the video sequence and the advertising clip before the insertion point to ensure a seamless transition. The advertising clip is selected based on the similarity between the salience maps of the video sequence and the advertising clip. The insertion point is preferably a point corresponding to a shot change in the video sequence to minimize the inconvenience of the spectator. The regions of interest are determined by generating salience maps for the video sequence and the advertising clip, and then determining the degree of similarity between them. The advertising clip with the highest degree of similarity is selected and inserted into the video sequence at the insertion point.
</summary>

The invention relates to a recessed mask structure that reduces localized high electric fields in semiconductor devices, particularly in the sub-250 nanometer range. The invention positions the mask member below the surface to be planarized, away from high electric field concentrations, and minimizes the thickness of the mask material to reduce overall capacitance.

<summary>
The present invention relates to a novel design implementation for an analog-to-digital converter that can sample and downconvert a modulated IF carrier to baseband. The invention comprises a digitally controlled variable gain amplifier, gain control logic, analog summing element, sampling element, predictive digital filter, and offset nuller element. These elements work together to convert the modulated IF input signal to a digital representation of the baseband in-phase and quadrature components, and to automatically control the processed modulated IF signal amplitude to extend the dynamic range of the digitization process and minimize quantization noise. The invention avoids several design implementation difficulties associated with conventional techniques and offers a rather inexpensive implementation. The novel design approach achieves the three processes of digitization, downconversion, and automatic gain control, resulting in improved dynamic range and reduced quantization noise.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a method for fabricating arrays of nano-scale features on a single wafer to form a sensor device or a matrix of devices for multiplex detection of selected analytes using many simultaneous detection zones. The method involves using nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes. These nanotraces can be used as a sensor or, when anchored probe molecules are covalently coupled or synthesized to the surfaces, be used for multiplex detection of analytes. The invention provides a cost-effective, time-efficient, and reproducible method for fabricating semiconducting active layers with nano-dimensional features for direct electrical detection in sensing applications. The method allows for controlled fabrication of nanophase features, providing a means for detection of gases adsorbed on the semiconductor surfaces or multiplex detection of many simultaneous detection zones. The invention solves the problem of reproducibly fabricating semiconducting active layers that provide the necessary nano-dimensional features for direct electrical detection in sensing applications.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a new method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages to prevent contamination of lead surfaces. The method involves plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a different material than the leads. The invention provides several embodiments, including full cutting and partial cutting methods, and uses a beveled edge or a partial bevel-edged blade to form a step on the singulated semiconductor packages. The plating material is configured not to react with oxygen, preventing contamination of the lead surfaces. The invention also provides a new, useful, and non-obvious method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and system for a mobile terminal to selectively connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN). The WWAN contains multiple base stations, while the WLAN contains at least one second base station for gathering service information of the first base stations. The mobile terminal has a first network module and a second network module. When the mobile terminal connects the WLAN, the second network module turns off and the first network module turns on. The first network module selects one of the first base stations as a serving base station according to the service information to connect the WWAN. The method provides a faster connecting procedure for the first network module by skipping some initial scanning procedures. If the first wireless module fails to connect the serving base station, it starts scanning the first base stations according to the channel information of the service information. The invention provides a more efficient and faster connecting method for a mobile terminal to select a serving base station in a communication system.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a process for producing multilayered components, particularly capacitors, by simplifying the manufacturing steps. The process involves providing electrodes and electrical components on a decal, locating them in stacked relation, and building up stacks of desired sizes. The invention also provides methods for interconnecting electrodes in stacked sub-assemblies and locating sub-assemblies in precise registered relation. The resultant assemblies are fabricated at low cost and high production rates using specialized tooling. The invention improves the manufacturing process by eliminating costly and labor-intensive steps, such as cutting and stacking individual electrodes and components.</summary>

The present disclosure relates to a hierarchical lattice structure comprising unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength. The unit cells may have different sizes, shapes, and cross-sectional configurations, and may be nested and mated according to the teachings of the present disclosure to form a hierarchical lattice structure.

<summary>
The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons, where a wet gasification stage gasifies coal to produce a combustion gas, and a dry gasification stage gasifies the combustion gas to produce a synthesis gas precursor. The process includes enriching a first portion of the combustion gas with hydrogen, mixing the enriched gas with the synthesis gas precursor, and synthesizing hydrocarbons from the mixed gas. The process also includes generating power from a second portion of the combustion gas and purifying a portion of the hydrogen gas to produce essentially pure hydrogen. The waste heat recovery stage waste heat boiler is co-fired with the fuel gas to raise the pressure and/or temperature of the steam generated by the waste heat recovery stage waste heat boiler. The process may include separating air to produce oxygen, which is used to combust the combustion gas to produce hot combustion gas and expand the hot combustion gas through a gas turbine expander to generate power and produce hot exhaust gas.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material. The method involves providing a blocking film (passivation film) on the surface or portion close to the surface of the superconducting material to prevent the removal of oxygen from that portion. The blocking film is formed using a photo CVD method and is made of an insulating material such as silicon nitride, aluminum nitride, or oxidized metal. The oxygen concentration in the region at the surface or close to it can be controlled by adding oxygen to the surface or portion close to the surface and then heat treating the entire body. The heat treatment is performed in an atmosphere of oxygen at a temperature of 300Â° C. to 900Â° C. The resulting device has the same conductivity characteristics at the surface portion as at the internal portion. The present invention is particularly useful for preparing a Josephson element structure, which is a type of superconducting device.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination. The apparatus includes a base structure, a clamping arrangement, and a screw thread specimen advance mechanism. The foam sheet sample is prepared by cutting it to a rectangular configuration, positioning it between the clamp bar and support bar, and lowering it until its bottom edge rests against the top surface of the saddle bar. The lower clamp pad is then moved into firm engagement with the foam sample, and the top clamp bar is moved into engagement with the foam sample to remove any curl. The hand nut is then freed from its locked position, and the foam sample is raised by 0.004 inch. The apparatus is designed to prepare repetitive samples with uniform thickness and parallel cut edges exposed for microscopic examination.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to seismometers, particularly those designed for use on the ocean floor. The invention provides a simple and inexpensive method for determining the angle of inclination of a seismometer during its operation. The invention also comprises an apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors carried in a seismometer. The invention mounts a geophone on the inside of a door of a water-tight instrument housing, providing a rigid connection between the detector and the frame of the seismometer. Acoustic commands are used to trigger the clamping of the detector into position after deployment of the seismometer. The invention provides a good acoustic path between the sea bottom and the detector, improving seismic coupling between the two.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a humidity sensing element that can be excited by low voltage microscopic currents from solid-state electronic instrumentation. The element does not depend on mechanical movements, is non-hygroscopic, and has a response time of about one second. The humidity sensing element consists of a first electrode, a porous coating of dielectric, minute particles of electron conductive material, and a second electrode pervious to moisture vapor. The impedance between the electrodes varies linearly with the relative humidity of the surrounding gas, and the element can be manufactured by a combination of familiar and non-exotic manufacturing methods.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a force transmission structure and a motor assembly, which solve the problems of vibration and noise generated by the conventional transmission structure. The invention provides a force transmission structure comprising a drive plate and a shaft, where the shaft is rotatably fitted to the drive plate through a toothed portion. The drive plate has a mounting hole with at least three sections interconnected at a common area, and the shaft has a toothed portion with at least three teeth fittingly received in the sections of the mounting hole. </summary>

<summary>
The present invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver. The invention includes an antenna, a radio frequency subsystem, and a baseband subsystem. The radio frequency subsystem is coupled to the antenna and includes a high frequency oscillator and a low frequency oscillator. The baseband subsystem is coupled to the radio frequency subsystem and includes a free running counter that provides a mobile time reference to the system. The invention also includes a method of generating a mobile time reference, which includes providing a high frequency clock, generating a mobile time reference using the high frequency clock, and maintaining the mobile time reference using a low frequency clock when the high frequency clock is not available.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a individually fitted helmet liner that can be rapidly and simply fitted to a wearer's head. The liner is made up of multiple layers of elastic thermoplastic sheets that are arranged in a superposed contacting relationship. The liner is custom-fitted to the wearer's head by heating the sheets to a plastic state, placing the liner between an outer fixture and the wearer's head, and removing the liner when it has cooled to a rigid, nonplastic state. The liner resists the tendency to shift position on the wearer's head and does not require drawstrings or the like during fitting.
</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a multiorifice structure for atomizing fluids, particularly in fuel injectors, and a method for producing the same. The structure comprises alternating layers of rods and cylindrical members fused together to form a plurality of angularly disposed passageways, which provide a directional component parallel to the angular displacement of the rods with respect to the common axis of the structure.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device, particularly an insulated gate field effect (IGFET) semiconductor device having a lightly doped drain (LDD) structure. The invention improves the controllability of the width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall during the manufacturing process. The method involves forming an insulating film on a gate electrode, then forming a low density n-type region by ion injection, and subsequently forming a high density n-type region by ion injection while using the insulating film and the gate electrode as a mask. The invention also provides a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device that minimizes the size of the device by making the junctions shallower, reducing the resistances of elements such as the gate electrode, and preventing hot carrier injection into the oxide portion on the gate sidewall.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to Internet telephony and provides an improved end-user interface for the same. The invention provides a low-cost IP telephone solution with reduced echo problems and improved speech quality. The enhanced radio telephone includes an internal speech coder for low power consumption and can be used with a standard PC for IP telephony. The invention allows for manual or automatic switching between wireless (e.g., cellular) operation and IP-telephone operation. The PC can perform conversions between coded speech signals and an appropriate computer network protocol. The invention provides a standard PC serial or parallel port connection for carrying digital speech and control signals in both directions between the enhanced radio telephone and the PC.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to devices for producing electrical power from surface waves on a water body. The invention improves upon prior art devices by using a single evacuated or surface vented gas-filled container submerged to a depth slightly below anticipated wave and swell troughs. The container has a fixed depth end and a movable end connected by a flexible, gas-tight bellows or diaphragm. Overhead waves and troughs produce hydrostatic pressure variations that compress and expand the container, which drives a hydraulic pump or motor. The invention enhances energy capture by partial evacuation or surface venting of the container, allowing for increased stroke and efficiency. The device can be adjusted for tides by hydrostatically sensing and adjusting the submerged depth.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and apparatus for mounting a scraped surface heat exchanger blade onto a drive shaft using a pin type connection. The blade has a blade body with a first side and a second side, and a scraper edge and a hinge edge. The blade also has at least one mounting hole extending through the blade body proximate to the hinge edge. The invention provides a L-shaped locking track protruding into the first side of the blade, having an entry track extending from the hinge edge and an intermediate track extending from the entry track to the mounting hole. Similarly, a second L-shaped locking track protrudes into the second side of the blade, having an entry track extending from the hinge edge and an intermediate track extending from the entry track to and past the mounting hole. The invention aims to facilitate the mounting of a scraped surface heat exchanger blade onto a drive shaft while still using a pin type connection.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a process and an apparatus for detecting and eliminating defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarettes in a cigarette magazine. The detection process involves using at least one optical checking element, such as a camera, to detect an image of a plurality of cigarettes located in the magazine. The image is evaluated by an image-processing device, and if there is a deviation from a reference image and/or from at least one reference value, an error signal is produced. The invention also relates to an elimination process for eliminating defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarettes. The process involves detecting a defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarette, and in response, actuating an ejecting unit to eject a plurality of cigarettes located in an ejecting zone assigned to the ejecting unit.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a device for interconnecting a high voltage cable with an apparatus and/or with a second high voltage cable. The invention provides a simplified connection system for cables having ratings up to 400 KV and above, offering advantages such as factory pre-testing, reduction of installation time and cost, and simplified field testing.</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a fixing mechanism for a tool in a machine tool, wherein at least one of the connecting surfaces in the tool frame and in the tool holder is shaped as a curved surface. The first contact surface and the second contact surface are adjusted to be placed against each other in the operational position of the fixing mechanism, transmitting machining force between the tool frame and the tool holder.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for generating supply voltages for display driver circuits at high efficiencies and with low EMI (electromagnetic interference). The invention provides modified switching regulator circuits that cancel out radiated noise by creating multiple paths for current flow. Additional terminal lines are provided to sink any EMI generated in the outermost paths. The invention can be used to drive larger displays, such as those used in Apple iPhone products, without incurring typical penalties associated with EMI or noise. The reduction in EMI is more pronounced by the use of terminal leads, which act as RF antennas to pick up any leaking fields generated by the last fully-connected paths in the circuit.
</summary>

<summary>

The text discusses techniques for rebalancing and charging battery packs in electric vehicles (EVs). The techniques aim to reduce the time spent rebalancing and charging the battery packs. The text introduces the concept of cell imbalance and its impact on the battery's performance. It also discusses the importance of accurately measuring the battery's state of charge (SOC) and voltage. The text provides equations for calculating the cell's maximum capacity, energy content, and voltage needed to provide a specified energy content. The text also discusses the impact of manufacturing tolerances, age, and temperature on the battery's capacity and voltage. Finally, the text highlights the importance of minimizing the time spent rebalancing and charging the battery packs to improve the overall efficiency of the EV.

</summary>

The invention relates to an AC-to-DC converter as a lamp power supply that converts an AC input voltage to a constant DC voltage at a predetermined value set by a potentiometer. The converter includes an input power supply, input protection circuit, EMI filter, rectifier, filter, converter, output filter, lamp, start circuit, control circuit, biasing circuit, input monitor circuit, and output protection circuit. The invention provides an AC-to-DC voltage converter as power supply for lamp, where the input power source is connected to input protection circuit, and the output of the converter is connected to output filter, lamp, and output protection circuit.

The present invention relates to a system for controlling the light levels in a space, such as an interior room, by controlling both the artificial light in the space and the control of motorized window treatments in the space to achieve a reasonably constant illumination on task surfaces throughout the space. The invention also provides a new approach to maintenance of illumination in a confined space where the sources of the illumination include combinations of daylight and electric lamps in the space. The system allows for variable and flexible daylight compensation without using separate sensing for each illumination zone and for integrated control of window treatments. The invention also describes a closed loop system for control of window shading devices and allows sun glare in the interior space to be controlled.

The Transportation Security Administration (TSA) was established in 2001 in response to security vulnerabilities in the US aviation industry, including weaknesses in screening passengers and baggage, controlling access to secure areas, and protecting air traffic control computer systems. TSA has made significant progress in improving aviation security, including deploying explosives detection systems, hiring and training screeners, and developing a registered traveler program to prescreen low-risk travelers.

The Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 and the Internal Revenue Code (IRC) sections 4911 and 162(e) have different definitions of lobbying-related terms, which can affect who must register and report under LDA. The differences in the definitions can also impact the number of organizations using each definition and the expenses they have reported.

The Government Accountability Office (GAO) has been assessing strategic sourcing in the federal government for over a decade, with a focus on improving procurement efficiency and reducing costs. The GAO found that while the federal government spends over half of its procurement budget on services, it struggles to manage services acquisition effectively, leading to inefficiencies and missed opportunities for savings. Leading companies have been able to save 4-15% on their services spending through strategic sourcing, and their approaches can provide insights for the federal government. The GAO identified practices used by large commercial organizations in purchasing services, including analyzing all procurement spending, centralizing management and knowledge sharing, and tailoring tactics based on service complexity and supplier number.

The current surface transportation program faces challenges in addressing key transportation challenges due to unclear goals and lack of links to performance. The program lacks effective tools and approaches to ensure efficient investment decisions, and the federal role is not clearly defined. The program also lacks a central source of data on congestion, and the upward trend in expenditures has affected its fiscal sustainability. The Highway Trust Fund faces an imbalance of revenues and expenditures, and the sustainability of transportation funding must be reexamined. Proposals to restructure and fund surface transportation programs should create well-defined goals based on identified areas of national interest, establish and clearly define the federal role, incorporate performance and accountability into funding decisions, and ensure fiscal sustainability. The proposals should also consider how costs and revenues will be shared among federal, state, local, and private stakeholders, address the need to better align fees and taxes with use and benefits, and provide flexibility and incentives for state and local governments to choose the most appropriate tool in the toolbox.

The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) engages in three primary activities: aviation safety oversight, air traffic control, and airport infrastructure development. The costs associated with these activities depend on the nature and usage of the specific service provided by FAA, such as licensing pilots and inspecting aircraft. The Trust Fund receives revenue from ticket taxes, passenger segment taxes, and international departure/arrival taxes, among others. However, the disconnect between Trust Fund revenues and FAA's workload increases concerns about revenue adequacy, equity, and efficiency.

The above text discusses the exposure of military personnel and civilians to chemical and biological substances during secret US military tests conducted between 1940 and 1975. The text outlines the efforts made by the US Department of Defense (DOD) to identify individuals who were potentially exposed to these substances, including the use of a task order to fulfill the provision of the Defense Authorization Act for FY 2003, which required DOD to review records and information necessary to identify members of the armed forces who were or may have been exposed to chemical or biological substances as a result of Project 112.

The text discusses the issue of firearms trafficking from the United States to Mexico and the efforts of U.S. law enforcement agencies to combat it. It highlights the struggle of the Mexican government to combat the growing power of criminal groups that have acquired firearms from the United States, and the role of U.S. agencies such as the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (ATF) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) in addressing this issue.

<summary>
The National Criminal History Improvement Program (NCHIP) was established in 1995 to improve public safety by enhancing the nation's criminal history records systems. The program is administered by the Bureau of Justice Statistics (BJS) and provides funding to states to improve their criminal history record systems, including automating records and making them accessible nationally. The program also supports the development of national data systems, such as the National Crime Information Center (NCIC) and the National Instant Criminal Background Check System (NICS). BJS has tried to ensure that the use of NCHIP funds is closely coordinated with the Edward Byrne Memorial Grant Program, which requires states to use at least 5% of their awards for improving criminal history records. All 50 states, the District of Columbia, and the U.S. territories have received NCHIP grants, totaling over $438 million from fiscal years 1995 to 2003. States have used NCHIP funds to improve their criminal history record systems, including automating records and making them accessible nationally. BJS officials could not quantify the NCHIP grant amounts that all states have allocated for staff to research arrest dispositions. Nonetheless, according to BJS, states may use NCHIP funds to research arrest dispositions in response to specific NICS-related queries, if the information is subsequently added to the automated system.
</summary>

Incinerators are used to clean up hazardous waste at Superfund sites. EPA sets standards for emissions and operations and requires engineering controls to prevent contaminants from being emitted. EPA also requires on-site oversight and monitoring to ensure that emissions remain within permitted levels.

The text describes the results of an audit conducted by the Office of Inspector General of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for the fiscal years 2007 and 2006. The audit found that SEC's financial statements were fairly stated in all material respects, but the internal control over financial reporting was inadequate.
